verses.verse: And it happened during the time for Him to be in a certain place praying; as He stopped, a certain one of His students said to Him, "Master, teach us to be praying, just as John also taught his students."
He said to them, "When you pray, say, Father, the One in the heavens, Your name must be made sacred. Your empire must come. What You want must happen, as in heaven, so also on the earth.
Give us the "daily" thing, our bread (the following day bread).
And forgive us our sins. You see, we ourselves also forgive everyone who owes us. And You will not carry us into trouble, but save us from the evil one."
And He said to them, "Who from among you will have a friend, will travel to him in the middle of the night, and might say to him, 'Friend, loan me three loaves of bread
since, for sure, my friend showed up to me from a trip and I don't have anything that I will place beside him'?

And when that person from inside answers, he might say, 'Don't bother me. The door has already been closed, and my young children are with me in the bed. I am not able after standing up to give it to you.'

I tell you, even if he will not give to him after standing up because of the fact for him to be his friend, because of his brazenness, he definitely, after being gotten up, will give him as much as he needs.
And I tell you, ask and it will be given to you. Look and you will find. Knock and it will be opened to you.
You see, everyone who asks receives, the person who looks finds, and to the person who knocks, it will be opened.
Whom of you (the father) will the son ask for bread? He will not give a stone over to him, will he? And if he will ask for a fish, he will not in place of a fish give a snake over to him, will he?
Or if he will also ask for an egg, he will not give a scorpion over to him, will he?
So if you all who are evil know to be giving good presents to your children, how much more will the Father, the One from heaven, give the Sacred Spirit to the people who ask Him?"
And He was throwing a demon out, and it was speech-impaired. It happened when the demon came out; the speech-impaired man spoke, and the crowds were amazed.
Some from among them said, "He throws the demons out with Beelzebub, the head of the demons."
Different ones, trying to cause trouble, were looking for an indicator from the side of Him from heaven.
He, realizing their thoughts, said to them, "Every empire that is thoroughly divided on itself becomes uninhabited, and a house thoroughly divided on a house falls.
If the Opponent also was thoroughly divided on himself, how will his empire be established? Because you say for Me with Beelzebub to be throwing the demons out.
If I throw the demons out with Beelzebub, your sons, with whom do they throw them out? Because of this, they will be judges of you.
But if I with a finger of God throw the demons out, clearly the empire of God already came on you.
When the strong person (having been fully armed) guards his own courtyard, the things that are his are in peace.
But whenever the person who is stronger than him comes on him, he conquers him. He takes his full body armor on which he had been confident and passes out his spoils.
The person who is not with Me is against Me, and the person who does not gather with Me scatters.

When the spirit that is not clean comes out from the person, it passes through places without water looking for a break. And not finding one, it says, 'I will return back into my house from where I went out.'
And when it comes, it finds that it has been swept and decorated.
Then it travels and takes along seven different spirits more evil than itself. And when they go in, it resides there, and the last of that person becomes worse than the first."

It happened during the time for Him to be saying these things; when a certain woman from the crowd raised up her voice, she said to him, "The belly, the one that hauled You, and the breasts that nursed You are blessed."
He said, "Yes, so of course the people hearing the message of God and observing it are blessed."
As the crowds accumulated more, He began to be saying, "This generation is evil. An indicator it is looking for, and an indicator will not be given to it except the indicator of Jonah, the preacher.
You see, just as Jonah became an indicator to the Ninevites, so will the Son of the Person also be to this generation.

A queen of the south will be gotten up during the judgment with the men of this generation and find them guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the insight of Solomon and, look, something better than Solomon is here.

Men of Nineveh will stand up during the judgment with this generation and find it guilty because they changed their ways into the public speaking of Jonah and, look, something better than Jonah is here.
No one, after lighting a lamp, places it into a hidden place or under the two gallon measuring bowl, but on the lampstand so that the people traveling in may see the glow.
The lamp of the body is the eye. So when your eye is dedicated, your whole body also is illuminated, but whenever it is evil, your body is also dark.
So keep an eye out for this, that the light, the light in you, is not darkness.
So if your whole body is illuminated, not having any dark part, the whole will be illuminated as when the lamp for the lightning illuminates you."
During the time to speak, a certain Separatist was asking Him a favor in order that He might have breakfast beside him. When He went in, He settled down.
When the Separatist saw it, he was amazed because he was not first submerged in water before the breakfast.
The Master said to him, "You, the Separatists, now clean the outside of the cup and the plate, but your inside is packed full of looting and evilness.
Distracted people, didn't the One who made the outside also make the inside?
More importantly, give the things that are inside as a charitable donation and, look, all things are clean to you.

But what a tragedy it is to you, the Separatists, because you take ten percent out of the sweet smelling mint, the rue leaves, and every vegetable and pass by the judgment and the love of God. It was necessary to do these things and not to leave those.
What a tragedy it is to you, the Separatists, because you love the front bench in the synagogue and the greetings in the marketplaces.

What a tragedy it is to you, Old Testament transcribers and Separatists, fakers, because you are as the burial vaults, the obscure ones; and the people, the ones traipsing around up on top, do not realize it."
When one of the law experts responds, he says to Him, "Teacher, these things that you are saying also injure us."

Jesus said, "And to you, the law experts, what a tragedy it is because you load the people down with heavy hard-to-haul loads and you yourselves with one of your fingers do not even lightly touch the heavy loads.
What a tragedy it is to you because you build the burial vaults of the preachers, but your fathers killed them.
Clearly you are witnesses and agree that you think the actions of your fathers are good, because they not only killed them, but you build their burial vaults.
Because of this, the insight of God also said, 'I will send preachers and missionaries out to them, and some from among them they will kill, and some they will chase out,'
so that the blood of all the preachers, that is spilled out since the world's founding, will be required out of this generation,
from the blood of Abel to the blood of the Zacharias that was ruined between the altar and the house. Yes, I tell you, it will be required out of this generation.
What a tragedy it is to you, the law experts, because you take away the key to the information yourselves. You did not go in, and you hindered the people going in."
As He said these things to them, the Old Testament transcribers and Separatists began to dreadfully be holding a grudge and to be making Him speak impromptu about more things,
lying in wait for Him and looking to snag something from His mouth so that they might level a complaint against Him.
